fields.description:
*Method 1* = User import issues
A normal user can click the elipses icon when viewing a list of issues to reveal a menu item "Import Issues from CSV"

*Method 2* = Admin External System Import
A SysAdmin user can use the External System Import features under the Site Administration area to import issues from a CSV

Using the same CSV import file for all steps.

h3. *If Time Tracking is set to Hours*
*Method 1* any values in Original Estimate that are less that 3600 are created in JIRA as 0m. 
 *Method 2*, these same values are correctly shown in JIRA as 15m, 30m, 45m, etc etc.

h3. *If Time Tracking is set to Minutes*
 *Method 1* works as expected.
 *Method 2* works as expected.
fields.summary: Original Estimate CSV values less than 1h will not import from issues import when time tracking set to Hours

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
When exporting Issues in Word format the company logo is not printed in the document.

*Suggested Solution:*
Add a feature that allows the user to choose if the logo should be included in the exported file or not.

*Workaround:*
-
fields.summary: Add the company logo when exporting to Word
Improve error message for unsupported content on issue fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If an image original file extension is .TIFF, and renamed to .png extension, when the file is uploaded to a JIRA issue, the image is unable to preview.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download a .TIFF image
# Change the file type to .png by renaming it from .TIFF to .png
# Upload the file to a JIRA issue
# The image is not viewable, however the file can still be downloaded.

h3. Expected Results
* The image should be viewable

h3. Actual Results
* The image is not viewable. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Additional Notes
User can check the original file extension by running *'file"* command in linux command prompt:
{noformat} 
root@root:/home/user# file Sample Image.png 
Sample Image.png: TIFF image data, little-endian
{noformat}
fields.summary: Can't preview image if the file type is renamed from .TIFF to .png

fields.description:
Problem
When a user uses another pc and for some reason, and he/she is not able to log out from this computer, there is no way to expire his/her sessions if he/she does not have physical access to the machine.

Suggestion
Allow Jira System Administrators to force a specific user to log out (expire the session) through the Administration console.
fields.summary: Force user session to expire

fields.description: Suggest the process to Re-activate / Re-import archived tickets for Search/Access later.
fields.summary: Reactivate Archived Projects
Comment "DOES NOT CONTAIN: !~" JQL fails to work with multiple comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a webhook is set to capture *Worklog* event, the payload doesn't include *Original Estimate* and *Remaining Estimate*

h3. Suggested Solution
Include *Original Estimate* and *Remaining Estimate* in Worklog updated event.
fields.summary: Include estimations in worklog updated in webhook's payload

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Create linked issue option is not working on Filter Results gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Filter Results gadget to display Business or Service Desk projects
# Try to click on the option *Create linked issue* on the gadget like in the image below:
 !create-linked-issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to see the Create Issue dialog to create the linked issue:
 !create-issue-dialog.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
There is no visual response and the linked issue is not created.
The only thing that happens when you select this option is that the URL is appended with a long string referencing the selected issue some other information.

h3. Notes
- The Create linked issue is working as expected when you are accessing the issue directly.
- On a side note, while checking the other options, noticed that the *Add Field* option in the same gadget sends the user to a 404 page.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The Create linked issue option is not working on Filter Results gadget

fields.description: It would be extremely helpful to be able to add color to labels (analogous to Epics).
fields.summary: Colored labels.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After creating an issue collector and configure it to collect custom fields, when you try later to edit this same issue collector you can see through the *Template preview* that the custom field still exists however you find them unchecked under the *Issue collector form* section. 



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue collector by accessing *issue collector* from the left side in the project level. 
# Save.
# After that, click edit for this same issue collector after accessing *issue collector* from the left side too.
# As you can see here the custom fields *Priority* and *Attach file* in my test instance: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The custom fields that were checked when creating the issue collector continue being checked. 

h3. Actual Results
* The custom fields are unchecked and simultaneously still showing up.


h3.Workaround
* Click the tile next to the custom field.
fields.summary: inaccurate behavior of Issue collector custom checkbox check/uncheck

fields.description: In JIRA Mobile for android, custom fields are not ordered as it's arranged in JIRA desktop. Fields should be arranged in JIRA Mobile as it's configured in JIRA Desktop, which would drastically improve the visibility of intended fields.
fields.summary: Custom Field ordering in JIRA desktop should be reflected in JIRA Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The sidebar is hiding notifications from the Add People screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any JIRA Cloud instance;
# Go to the settings of any project;
# Add People to the project.

h3. Expected Results
* The notification that you've added (or removed) people from your project is shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results
* The notification is partly hidden by the sidebar.

 !Bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* There is none. Bug confirmed on Google Chrome (Version 63.0.3239.132 (Official Build) (64-bit), Mozilla Firefox 57.0.4 (64-bit) and Apple Safari Version 11.0.2 (11604.4.7.1.6).
fields.summary: Sidebar is hiding Add People notifications
Sidebar is hiding Add People notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you use a different field configuration for an issue type in a project and in this field configuration you hide the *Time Tracking* field, the *Log work* link won't appear in the issue view for any of the issues types.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a project.
* Create a field configuration and hide the Time tracking field.
* In the field configuration scheme page, find the scheme used by the project and associate the new field configuration with one of the issue types present in the project.
* Create an issue selecting another issue type.

h3. Expected Results

* The *Log work* should be available.

 !Screen Shot 2018-01-17 at 4.53.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

* The *Log work* link does not show.

 !Screen Shot 2018-01-17 at 4.54.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Go to field configuration where the Time Tracking field is hidden and click on _Show_ to make it visible again.
fields.summary: Hiding the Time Tracking field for an issue type makes the Log work link disappear for other issue types

fields.description:
When creating a user in Jira, the email address should not exceed 64 characters. In case you try adding a user with over 64 characters, an error saying that the user creation is not possible at the moment is returned, as represented below.
 *  !Screen Shot 2018-01-17 at 15.14.14.png|thumbnail! 

Instead of returning this non-conclusive error message, Jira could have a way of truncating the email address whenever this reaches its max length. 

This could maybe be done by adding a check for the number of characters before the "@" character.
fields.summary: Jira should truncate the user email upon creation

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to comment internally in JIRA Mobile, As it is now when end users scroll through a ticket to the comment field and begin typing, it goes in as "to the customer". 

The functionality to comment internally via the mobile app is requested.
fields.summary: Ability to comment internally in JIRA Mobile.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Log work is missing on {{...}} button

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a field configuration 1
# Create a field configuration 2
# Hide {{Time Tracking}} on field configuration 2
# Create a field configuration scheme
#* Set field configuration 1 as default and associate field configuration 2 to an issue type 
# Create a project
#* Ensure the issue type set on field configuration scheme is available on the project
# Create an issue using a different issue type (one using the default field configuration)
# Try logging work on the issue

h3. Expected Results
Log work should be missing only for the issue type where the field was hidden

h3. Actual Results
Log works doesn't work on the project
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
* Change the field configuration to show the field Time Tracking
fields.summary: Log work is missing

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

Activities made on sprints (Software projects) are not logged work. For example: create sprint / delete sprint / etc.

 

*Suggested Solution:*

Add to the log work the activities made on the sprints.

 

*Workaround:*

-
fields.summary: Log work for Sprint activities

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users would have the ability to auto-forward assignments/tasks if an employee is on holiday or on sick leave.
h3. Expected Result

When a user is on leave, the assigned tasks/assignments would have been reassigned automatically to other users
h3. Actual Result

There is no such option given in the Jira system.
fields.summary: Auto forwarding new assignments during absence (illness/holidays)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Sub-task is moved to a new parent, deleting the old parent would also delete the sub-task, even though they are not linked anymore.

h3. Environment
 * Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue, lets call it Parent A.
# Create a sub-task from Parent A, lets call it Sub-task-1.
# Go to the sub-task, click on the " . . . " -> Move. Select "Change Parent", and select any other issues in the same project.
# Ensure that Sub-task-1 is no longer a sub-task of Parent A, and that Parent A no longer has any sub-tasks.
# Delete Parent A.

h3. Expected Results
Parent A would be the only issue that is deleted. Sub-task-1 should not be deleted, as Parent A is no longer the parent of Sub-task-1.

h3. Actual Results
Sub-task-1 gets deleted together with Parent A.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: When a Sub-task is moved to a new parent, deleting the old parent would also delete the sub-task

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira is not processing any incoming emails - issues are not created.  This issue applies to mail handlers that are using the POP Mail Server(default mail server).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a mail handler that is using the "POP Mail Server"
# "Edit" the "POP Mail Server" and click "Test Connection"
# Send a test email

h3. Expected Results
 * Tests are successful
 * Issues are created from emails

h3. Actual Results
* Incoming email doesn't create a new issue
* Jira application logs are showing this error:
|2018-01-17 11:43:24.220	|WARN	|com.atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice|	mail_handler_name[10301]: com.sun.mail.util.MailConnectException: Couldn't connect to host, port: mailstore, 110; timeout 10000 while connecting to host 'mailstore' as user 'jira@instance_name.atlassian.net' via protocol 'pop3, caused by: java.net.UnknownHostException: mailstore|

 
h3. Notes
* The default mail server hostname is "mailstore"
* When testing the mail server connection, an error is thrown:  
{noformat}
Unfortunately no connection was possible. Review the errors below and rectify:

UnknownHostException: mailstore
{noformat}
* In some(but not all) cases, the email sender is getting a bounce message - "550 5.1.1 Mailbox does not exist"

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Jira mail handler using the default mail server is not creating tickets

fields.description: It would be nice if if Customer could be granted permission to search organization without the permission to share request with organization.
fields.summary: Customer permission to search organization for approvers without the permission to share requests with all customers and organisations.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira import from Server to Cloud failed with upgrade task error 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform an import of Jira from Server to Cloud

h3. Expected Results
* Import completed successfully

h3. Actual Results
* Jira import failed with the following error in UI
{code}
The upgrade task manager has returned a non-successful result from running the upgrades. Tasks:
{code}

* Log entries
{code}
We've got an UpgradeTask with no associated DowngradeTask Build Number: 1 Factory Key: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin
{code}
{code}
cloud.atlassian.provisioning.exception.PermanentProvisioningFailureException: Import task failed: [The upgrade task manager has returned a non-successful result from running the upgrades. Tasks: ] at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.CloudBackupManager.startImport(CloudBackupManager.java:97) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.ImportResource.lambda$importArchive$1(ImportResource.java:76) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.lambda$withTenantedWorkContext$0(AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.java:69) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.filter.InternalResource.withWorkContext(InternalResource.java:104) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.withTenantedWorkContext(AbstractCloudProvisionerResource.java:67) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.ImportResource.importArchive(ImportResource.java:75) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.ImportResource.lambda$post$0(ImportResource.java:66) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AsyncCloudTaskRunner$AsyncCloudProvisionerHelper.wrapTask(AsyncCloudTaskRunner.java:148) at com.atlassian.jira.internal.rest.AsyncCloudTaskRunner$AsyncCloudProvisionerHelper.lambda$runAsync$0(AsyncCloudTaskRunner.java:128) at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590) at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.exec(CompletableFuture.java:1582) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.doExec(ForkJoinTask.java:289) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.runTask(ForkJoinPool.java:1056) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1692) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:157)
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
* Extract the backup file
* Remove the following entries from entities.xml 
{code}
<UpgradeTaskHistory id="10200" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin" buildNumber="1" status="COMPLETED" upgradeType="SERVER"/>
 
<UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10200" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-development-integration-plugin" buildNumber="1" status="COMPLETED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-01-16 09:44:54.0" action="upgrade"/>
{code}
* Re-zip the backup file and perform another import
** Verify the zip archive keeps the structure through such as {{unzip -l}}:
{code:none}
├── activeobjects.xml
├── entities.xml
├── data
│ ├── attachments
│ └── avatars
└── logos
{code}
fields.summary: Jira import from Server to Cloud failed with a non-successful result from running the upgrades

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Search using colon ':' and semi-colon ';' characters in a custom text field doesn't work as expected

h3. Environment
*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field type text and add it to the issues' screens
# Create tree new issues
# Add the value 00:00 to the filed in issue Test-1
# Add the value 01:00 to the filed in issue Test-2
# Add the value 00;00 to the filed in issue Test-3
# Run this search 
{noformat}
cf[xxxx] ~ '00:00'
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Search should return only the issue Test-1

h3. Actual Results
Search returns all the three issues.


h3. Notes
* Search returns all the three issues when ran below JQL 
{noformat}
cf[xxxx] ~ '00;00'
{noformat}
 * Search returns Test-2 as expected when ran the below JQL
{noformat}
cf[xxxx] ~ '01:00'
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
None so far
fields.summary: Search using colon and semi-colon in a custom text field doesn't work as expected

fields.description: I, as JIRA administrator, would like that Atlassian add one or more "system utilities" that I could use to manage things like this. As a start, I would like it to include a utility to find references to "deleted groups", references to deactivated and deleted users, and a utility to recover deleted issues. I am sure there would be a LOT of other "clean-up" type utilities that could be included.

fields.description:
I have tried following curl command to access service desk rest api but it's return 401 authenticate failed error.When i access same API with login on browser directly then it is working.

curl -D- -u user:password -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" [https://xxx.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk]

 

Note:  This API is  working properly with jira user's credentials  but when i use service desk customer's credential then it is not working.

we were using this api from last few months it was working fine but from last week it is not working.
fields.summary: JIra service desk rest api authentication return 401

fields.description:
h2. Update
We are rolling out the fix, it should be applied to all tenants within the next few hours.


h3. Summary
It is not possible to select Tempo's Account field for any issues in the project. This affects Tempo's Team field as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Tempo Account
# Link it to the project
# Try to select the Tempo Account in the project

h3. Expected Results
# Tempo's Account field should have Accounts to be selected

h3. Actual Results
# Account field is currently empty.
fields.summary: Tempo's Account field not able to be selected in projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using JIRA's new interface, in *View all projects* page, when use *CTRL + Click* to open a project in a new tab, or using *Shift + Click* to open a project in a new window will impact the current page as well and will redirect the current tab/window to the project's page (to which the new tab/window should be directed).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch to [JIRA's new interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience-937886012.html] (if you are using the old interface)
# Go to *View all projects* page: https://<domain-name>.atlassian.net/projects?page=1&selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all
# Hold *CTRL* and click on a project name to open it in a new tab
# Hold *Shift* and click on a project name to open it in a new window

h3. Expected Results
* The project will be opened in the new tab/window
* The current page/tab won't be redirected and will remain at the same page

h3. Actual Results
* The project will be opened in the new tab/window (as expected)
* The current page also will be redirected to the project (same as the new tab/window)

h3. Workarounds
# Switch to JIRA's old interface (if available)
# Disable browser's JavaScript:
#* [How to enable JavaScript in your browser|https://www.enable-javascript.com/]
fields.summary: Using CTRL + Click and Shift + Click to open the project in a new tab/window will redirect the current tab/window

fields.description:
Currently, the Jira Calendar plugin only allows 200 events as a maximum limit.

Improve the plugin events limit and add to the customers the ability to set the maximum events they need.
fields.summary: Increase Jira Calendar event limit

fields.description:
*Summary*

When the user tries to create a new issue, from the Backlog screen, and select the "Where is my field?" button, the page start to load (unsuccessfully), and get stuck.


*Steps to reproduce*

1. In a project backlog click the "Create issue" button, then click the "three dots" button
   !01.png|thumbnail! 
2. Click the configure "fields button"

3. Click the "Where is my field button"

 

*Expected Results*

The user should be able see the box "Where is my field?". 

*Actual Results*

The box doesn't load, it gets stuck. 

*Workaround*

Create issues using the shortcut *"C"* or clicking the "*+"* button.
fields.summary: "Where is my field" - doesn't load when created from backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* After creating a checkbox custom field and creating different options to choose from.
* If the number of options to choose from is higher than 2 options, it would more friendly experience to the user if he can select one checkbox called *Select All* instead of checking one by one. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* When configuring the checkbox custom field give a choice to the administrator to provide the "select all" option among the other options of the field. 

h3. Why this is important
Easier user experience
fields.summary: Add a "Select All" option for checkbox custom field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When setting up a 'Notify HipChat' post-function to notify an HC room, we can configure the message, including variables (such as '$issue' to add issue key and information):
!custom-message.png|thumbnail!

When we add the variable *issue* or *summary*, any issue with a dollar sign ($) in its summary will not be notified in the room.

This is likely because those two variables add summary to the notification (the issue variable contains issue key, type and summary) and it 'gets confused' at some point with the '$' sign used to represent the variable value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira with your HipChat
# Create a 'Notify HipChat' post-function to a transition in a workflow (used by a project)
#* Configure it so the 'Message' includes either the '$issue' or the '$summary' variables (such as 'This is the issue: $issue')
# Create 2 issues, one with a dollar sign in summary, another without
# Transition both using the transition containing the post-function

h3. Expected Results
Both issues notify the HipChat room

h3. Actual Results
Only the issue without the dollar sign notifies the room
 
h3. Notes
*There is another project configuration to fire notifications in HipChat, clicking 'HipChat' in project sidebar. This one is not affected, only the post-function one is (screenshot below shows the configuration that works).*

h3.Workaround
Use the project configuration to trigger notifications, as this is not affected:
!hc_integration.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Notify HipChat post-function fails with summaries with dollar signs when using variables

fields.summary: Ability to drag subtasks between stories when viewing a sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The function of notifying a user when a new label, version or component is created/edited is not available
h3. Suggested Solution

The instance would have the option of letting specific users know when a version, component or label is created/edited.
h3. Why this is important

There is no function of notifying a specific user when a new component, label or version is created/edited. 

This is important because if the users are looking into receiving updates specifically on label, version or component is created/edited. This is important to customers because this could actually help them when the smaller details of the issue are being updated.
fields.summary: Creating new labels,versions,components and notifying it to specific users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some databases contain some 'invalid' characters that are exported via Backup Manager. These files could be imported before with JIRA importer, but cannot anymore.

Some characters that are preventing the import are: {{^L}} (Form Feed, 0x0C) and {{^H}} (Backspace, 0x08) (check [this|http://donsnotes.com/tech/charsets/ascii.html]).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a JIRA with some of the invalid characters in the database
# Export it
# Try to reimport it

h3. Expected Results
Either:
# Backup Manager filters out these characters on exporting
# Import removes them or imports with them.

h3. Actual Results
This error below is shown on UI:
 !JIRA invalid character error.png|thumbnail! 

Errors thrown in the logs:
{code}

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Search in JIRA is slow when the JQL contains CHANGED keyword

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Search for issues in JIRA
# Use a JQL that contains CHANGED keyword. For example, status CHANGED TO "Done" AFTER "2017/01/1"

h2. Expected Result
The search returns result quickly.

h2. Current Result
The search takes more than 20 seconds to return the result.
fields.summary: Search is slow when JQL contains CHANGED keyword

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the new JIRA experience, there are inconsistencies between the text style in boards and issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project together with a board
# Create an issue and add headings to it
# Wile having the new UI enabled click on the active sprint or the backlog of the created board
# Click on any issue to open the sidebar 
# Right-click on the issue-id and open the detail view in a new tab
# Compare the fonts (size & margin above/below) of any Heading fonts between the sidebar view and the detail view.

h3. Expected Results

The headings and the overall text should be rendered equally on the issue view and on the board.

h3. Actual Results
They are rendered with different styles:
!issue.png|thumbnail!

!boh.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The text font in boards and issues is being rendered differently

fields.description:
When an email handler which was previously in use is disabled or removed, some customers might still send email requests to the disabled mail handler. 

 

It would be great if the *bounce email template* could be made custom. That way customers can be told where to raise their request.
fields.summary: Allow Custom Bounce Emails
Add 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *' to '/atlassian-connect/all.js' to support CORS

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some users might be unable to temporarily see Jira sidebar in the new UI.

(Other problems may occur as dashboards loading blank and other areas of Jira)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Not easily reproducible.

Note: This can happen for various reasons, the symptom is usually missing/blank areas in the new UI.

h3. Expected results 

The sidebar and other icons should render normally.

h3. Actual result

The sidebar and other items loads blank

h3. Workaround

Before, contacting [support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] try the following possible workarounds:

# Using incognito mode may work for some cases.
# Opening the development console and going to the network tab marking the option "Disable cache" and refreshing the page.
# A different browser may also work.
fields.summary: Some users may be unable to see the left sidebar in Jira new UI

Date picker calendar shows week number off by one week. This happens in new and old UI.
  !dateweek.JPG|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-12 at 3.28.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Date picker is wrong for customers using Jira in any European language.

Workaroung: use Jira in English/Portuguese
fields.summary: An incorrect week number in datepicker is wrong starting from Jan 2018

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Email notifications present inconsistent behavior when workflow transition executed has webhook triggers. This issue affects the content of the email notification, causing it to not have the change information displayed

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # In a workflow transition, add a _post function_ to fire a webhook after the notification event is fired.
 ** !Screen Shot 2018-01-12 at 12.55.36.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an issue and perform the transition
 # Observe the email notification received

h3. Additional information
 * Issue seems to affect multiple if not all issue events, as the issue was reproduced when testing both the *Generic Event* and the *Issue Resolved* events
 * Issue causes the notification to not display what was changed in the transition. When the issue is reproduced, email contains only the event but no further details about it. On the other hand, when the issue *is not* reproduced, the notification contains information about what was changed in the transition
||When is the problem||When is not the problem||
|!Screen Shot 2018-01-12 at 12.54.53.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2018-01-12 at 12.55.03.png|thumbnail!|


*Note:* This issue is related to the bug [JRACLOUD\-68498: The more post\-functions to fire webhooks we add on a specific transition, more likely it can break notifications|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68498] and is probably caused by the same problem.
fields.summary: Webhook triggers in workflow transition cause inconsistency in email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you have a lot of versions/releases on your list you are forced to scroll through all existing versions to be able to add a new version at the bottom of the page. This takes time due to the infinite scrolling feature fetching and rendering more records. 

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an input field to the top of the versions/releases list.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Add input field to the top of Project releases/version list page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you open the basic issue search with no JQL, it took a minute or so for the search to load

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to open issue search
# The page is blank for a minute or so to load the page

h3.Workaround
# Try to load a search with a JQL, or perform project-based search
# Load a filter in order to open the search
fields.summary: Slowness when loading empty search/basic search

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Issues created directly on boards are not searchable in the linked issue search box. 

 

*Environment*

The New Jira Experience For Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project with a Board
 # Go to the Board View of The Project
 # Create an Issue directly from the Board View 
 # Go to an existing issue on the Board View > Click on it
 # Click on the Link Issue button > Search For the newly created Issue > It will not appear

 

Video To Replicate:
 [^new_issue_view_link.mp4]
h3. *Expected Results*

When a user enters an ISSUE-KEY in the link issue search box, it appears as an option to submit even if the issue has not been returned in the results.
h3. *Actual Results*

Issues created directly on boards are not searchable in the linked issue search box. 

 
h3. *Workarounds*

 * Create an issue by clicking "Create" > "Issue" on the left-hand side menu instead of creating issues on the board directly 
 * Create the issue on the board directly and then view the issue that needs to be linked directly in the "Issue Navigator". From that point onwards, the issue should be searchable within the "Link" issue feature within the new issue view.
 * Link issues using the "Issue Navigator" by clicking … > "Link"
fields.summary: New Jira Experience: Searching for issues in linked issue field of a board view is inaccurate with the search results
Jira Cloud import progress crawls at Upgrading Database

fields.description:
Hi,

In my organization we have the tendency to create new branches for our projects in Bitbucket from the ticket in the Jira Sprint. This way the branch is named properly and linked to the ticket effortlessly.

When I click on the "Create branch" button in the ticket I expect that a new tab opens with the Bitbucket interface while leaving my tab with the Jira board intact.

What actually happens is that when I click on "Create branch" I get redirected to Bitbucket and after creating the branch I have to go back to my Jira board somehow.

It is not an issue that disrupts my workflow or makes me loose too much time but it adds to improve the user experience.

 

Thanks in advance,

Carlos Moro García
fields.summary: Create new branch in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachments only importer in Atlassian Jira Cloud fails with certain ZIP file size. The failure is more consistent with files at 2GB or more in size.

No error thrown in Jira and the import just fails silently.
h3. Current Result

Import fails without any indication.
h3. Expected Result
 # The importer should be able to handle any size of attachments import or specify the limit.
 # If it fails, an error should be thrown.

h3. Workaround

Split the attachments into smaller chunks e.g. project by project.

In the case where a single project contain more than 1GB total attachments size, the files can still be split on issues hierarchy level.

(!) Make sure the hierarchy of the end ZIP file is correct. Below is an example of the hierarchy:
{noformat}
attachments-1.zip
└─── data
       ├── attachments
       │       ├── ProjectKey1
       │       │          └── 10000
       │       │                ├── IssueKey-1
       │       │                ├── IssueKey-2
       │       │                └── IssueKey-3
       │       ├── ProjectKey2
       │       └── ProjectKey3
       └── avatars
attachments-2.zip
└─── data
       └── attachments
               ├── ProjectKey4
               ├── ProjectKey5
               └── ProjectKey6
attachments-3.zip
└─── data
       └── attachments
               └── ProjectKey7

{noformat}
fields.summary: Attachments only importer fails with certain ZIP file size

fields.description:
We create sub-tasks using project automation for many different issue types like New Hires, Computer Rebuilds, Software Deployments, etc...

Many times we use bulk operations to complete many but not all the tasks in the list. The column width is roughly about 32 characters wide, and we cannot see the entire summary to make bulk edits. We would like to be able to adjust the columns for the bulk edit and search results page with the end result being able to see the entire summary. 

Maybe even a word wrap, instead of column adjusting would allow to see the entire summary and solve the issue. 

Thanks
fields.summary: As a user of Jira Service Desk and Jira Software,  when using Bulk Operations or Search, I would like to see the complete issue summary

fields.description:
Gsuite administrators have found that the google synch if it fails does not notify the administrators. This means that the administrators have to be on reactive mode and are unable to troubleshoot login issues before their end users complain. 

This can cause an impact for users who are unable to carry out their tasks as they are locked out of the instance till an administrator of their instance is available to review the logs and progress from there,
fields.summary: GSynch Fails without notifacation to Administrators

There is the need to add a Distribution List as a watcher in Jira issues. At this moment is not possible to create as it does not accept this kind of user.

Also, the documentation below is not applicable anymore.
* [How to Configure an Email Distribution System|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-an-email-distribution-system-741739384.html].
fields.summary: Distribution List as watcher

Hi everyone,

This shortcut is available in the new issue view. 

Thanks for your feedback on this issue

The Atlassian Product Team

Problem
 When selecting an issue and pressing 'a' from the board, a pop-up with the issue view appears instead of the assignment pop-up.

Suggestion
 The possibility to use the shortcut directly from the board would be very helpful. This used to work but it's not available now.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When importing a CSV file, Jira does not perform any type of verification. Because of that, it is possible to change an issue's issue type to an issue type with different workflow / type (e.g. *Task* issue type to *Sub-task* issue type), resulting in data inconsistencies.

h3. Details
 * Because of this bug, it is possible to change an issue's Issue Type from a *TASK* issue type to a *Sub-task* issue type, causing inconsistencies (check [JRACLOUD\-67480: Lack of parent/sub\-task validation in CSV import causes invalid state|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67480] for more details)
 * Furthermore, this error results in Workflow inconsistencies, as the workflow associated in the database does not match the one showed in the UI
 **  !Screen Shot 2018-01-11 at 17.42.17.png|thumbnail! 
 Note: In this case, the *name* column describes the workflow actually associated with the issue. By accessing the issue through the UI and clicking *View workflow*, the workflow displayed is the one defined in the *Workflow* column

h3. How to reproduce
 # Create an issue with any issue type
 # Create a CSV file to update that issue's issue type, such as the one below:
 {code}
Issue Id,Issue Type,Summary
<Issue Key>,<New Issue type>,,
{code}
 ** Notice that in order to reproduce the bug, the issue type should be one that uses a different workflow in the project
 # Go to *System > External System Import > CSV* and import the issue in the project

h3. Expected Behavior:
 * Jira should not allow the user to update the issue to an invalid issue type

h3. Actual Behavior:
 * Jira allows the user to update the issue to any issue type (including a *Sub-task* issue type, causing the issue to have no parent)

h3. Proposed solution:
 * Jira could use the same verification used when trying to edit an issue's issue type through the View Issue screen
fields.summary: Jira allows update to invalid issue type through CSV Import

fields.description:
During Wallboard setup, we can obtain a link to share the wallboard without regard to other sharing settings. 

Having such a link will allow us to show the board as part of an information radiator. 

Many products, like Google Drive, have the capability to share a resource with anyone who has a specific link. 

Ideally, the sharing link would be shown, and we'd be able to disable it.
fields.summary: Wallboard public sharing link

fields.description:
During Wallboard setup, we can obtain a link to share the wallboard without regard to other sharing settings. 

Having such a link will allow us to show the board as part of an information radiator. 

Many products, like Google Drive, have the capability to share a resource with anyone who has a specific link. 

Ideally, the sharing link would be shown, and we'd be able to disable it.
fields.summary: Wallboard public sharing link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This BUG occurs in a very specific scenario. If we add a post-function to trigger a custom webhook, the 'system' webhook which is also triggered intermittently doesn't contain *changelog* information. The custom webhook is apparently not affected.

The broken webhook in question can be verified using the [Cloud Inspector|https://connect-inspector.prod.public.atl-paas.net/page/start ] tool.

The more post-functions to fire webhooks we add, more likely the transition will not trigger a notification in add-ons that need the *changelog* information that is sent along with the webhook payload. The information related to the changelog won't be found on the webhook JSON payload. 

Please note that this information won't be available on webhooks fired by default by the system. It seems that they are not the same as the regular webhooks that are fired by JIRA (AO_4AEACD_WEBHOOK_DAO). We can only see this when using the connect-inspector to monitor the webhooks fired: https://connect-inspector.prod.public.atl-paas.net/page/start 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the connect-inspector in a test instance - https://connect-inspector.prod.public.atl-paas.net/page/start 
# Create a workflow that has a transition setup exactly like the following: 
** With a screen associated
** With at least two post-functions to trigger regular webhooks - _Send transition to webhook: YourWebhook_
# Start to add more post-functions to trigger other webhooks one by one and transition the issue while monitoring the payload catch by the connect-inspector
# At some point, the connect-inspector will show that no data regarding the changelog information is being recorded on the JSON payload.

E.g.:

 !post functions.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The JSON payload should contain this kind of information when the issue is transitioned, no matter how many post-functions are triggering webhooks:

{code}
"changelog": {
    "id": "966624",
    "items": [
      {
        "field": "resolution",
        "fieldtype": "jira",
        "fieldId": "resolution",
        "from": "10000",
        "fromString": "Done",
        "to": null,
        "toString": null
      },
      {
        "field": "status",
        "fieldtype": "jira",
        "fieldId": "status",
        "from": "10104",
        "fromString": "Completed",
        "to": "3",
        "toString": "In Progress"
       }
    ]
  }
}

JSON end

{code}

h3. Actual Results

The webhook payload that is sent to add-ons for consumption will not have the changelog information:

{code}
...

"customfield_13900": null,
      "customfield_15802": null,
      "customfield_13902": null,
      "customfield_15803": null,
      "customfield_13901": null,
      "comment": {
        "comments": [],
        "maxResults": 0,
        "total": 0,
        "startAt": 0
      }
    }
  }
}

JSON end

{code}

As we can see above, the JSON ends without having information about the changelog. 

h3. Notes

This is known to cause at least this problem:
* Add-ons like Slack rely on the changelog information to display a notification on a channel about the issue being transitioned.
fields.summary: The more post-functions to fire webhooks we add on a specific transition, more likely it can break notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira Cloud users do not have anywhere to refer to when there is an issue with the REST API specifically. The site status.atlassian.com only shows the performance and availability of Jira Cloud in general, and there is no specific monitoring for REST API.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the status of the REST API in the page, similar to how the Bitbucket API is monitored and shown.
 !status-page.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
Users can refer to the page to check on the status of the REST API, and if they have subscribed, they can be notified of any known issues with the REST API.
fields.summary: Provide the Jira Cloud REST API availability and status on status.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Activity Stream gadget is not sorting activities correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have the Activity Stream gadget on a dashboard, with activity from a day before, preferably.

h3. Expected Results
The activity is displayed ordered, starting with activity from 'Today' and then showing activity from previous days.

h3. Actual Results
The activity stream does not have a specific order. It can start showing activity from 'Yesterday', then 'Today' and 'Yesterday' and then the other days.
 !activity-order.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- On older activity, the date may not match. For example, checking the Activity Stream on *Thursday*, and expanding to show older activity, the activity from *Monday* displayed as *2 days ago*:
 !verified-thrusday.png|thumbnail! 
- In certain cases, clicking on *Show more* to display older activity can also change the displaying order.

h3.Workaround
Try to clean the cache and refresh the page.
fields.summary: The Activity Stream gadget is not sorting activities correctly

fields.description:
Currently, the CRM for Jira add-on is mapping Reporter to CRM Contacts. Instead, I would like to be able to map issues to CRM Contacts.

Being able to attach multiple CRM Contacts per issue would be even better.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I would like to map an issue to one or more CRM contacts

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When a project is created via mobile app, the project settings for it only contains *Project Name* and *Project Key*. All the other configurations, schemes are missing from *Project Settings*.
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create a project using mobile app
# Navigate to the project settings in your browser

h2. Expected Result
The project settings should be the same as a project created in browser

h2. Current Result
The configurations are missing from project settings

h2. Workaround
Create the project from browser.
fields.summary: Missing configuration when projects are created by mobile app

fields.description:
Several suggestions to improve overall search experience in new look and feel:

1. When typing in search and hitting enter right after text input, Jira will redirect you to the first chosen result - it can be a first result of the search or it can be 'View all issues' link or anything 'cached' from previous search.
As a result, your search will redirect you to 'random' pages.

Expectations:
If at the moment of hitting enter after text input there were no results found yet, redirect to the 'Issue search' page that includes search pattern similar to 'View all matching issues', i.e.:

summary ~ "<search_text>" ** OR description ~ "<search_text>" ORDER BY lastViewed DESC

2. Implement 'smart search'.
For example, you have issue 'IT-123' with a subject 'Test'.
If you try to search for 'IT test', there will be no results of the issue 'IT-123'
If you try to search for 'IT 123', there will be no results of the issue 'IT-123'

3. When search is empty and you hit enter - Jira redirects you to 'advanced search' screen.
fields.summary: Improvement to quick search in the side bar for Jira

fields.description: Since some instances require the usage of numeric fields that utilize more than 3 decimal places, it would be ideal to be able to customize the amount allowed before the field rounds up the number.
fields.summary: Allow for more than 3 decimal places in Number Fields

fields.description:
h3. ***Feature Request***
Add-on users should not be listed as assignable users in Jira tickets, this can be confusing.

h3. ***Current Behavior***
When add-ons are installed, the add-on user starts to appear as an assignable user for the issues.
fields.summary: Non-human users should not appear in assignee dropdown

fields.description: Too much unused space at the top of the page in the new JIRA UI. In the old UI, there were some toolbars. But this one has just blank area. Could be utilized for some useful stuff.
fields.summary: Unused spaces in new JIRA experience pages

fields.description:
h3.Actual results
When a domain owner make changes on users accounts, the users receive a notification regarding the changes.

h3.Expected results
*   We did not make any change to id.atlassian.com or any users account
*   If we make any changes to new JIRA instance it should not send email to all other instance users without  JIRA Admin approval
*   Basic Purpose of creating different Instance to avoid any kind of interfere  with each other
*   JIRA Cloud should allow JIRA Admin to pick and choose when they want to notify user for change or not because most companies have their own way to notify and communicate their users about any changes
*   It’s ok to notify to all JIRA admin and Account owners
fields.summary: Users being notified when domain owner changes something on the account

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Depending on the number of epic links you have on your project, you may find out that the drop-down menu search is not actually performing well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Having an instance with more than 3K epic links
# Create or edit an issue, try to fetch the epic links drop-down list

h3. Expected Results
 * The list will be rendered in at least 5 seconds

h3. Actual Results
 * Depending on the sheer number of epic links and their status it can take up to 20 seconds to load the whole list.

h3. Workaround

# Change status of epic links unused to DONE
# Unmark the option "Show done epics" if it's marked.
fields.summary: Epic link drop-down poor performance with large amounts of epic links

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a notification sent to the JIRA Administrators group when JIRA is unable to connect to one of the mail servers or if there are any issues at all with the email handlers.

This would help in administrators being able to correct what issues are occurring and prevent email being lost.
fields.summary: Notification when JIRA Is unable to connect to mail server.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new user interface, users that have rights to create issues and projects after pressing button"+", they need to choose between creating an issue or creating a project. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The user interface can be set so that after pressing button "+" only the option for creating an issue is available for all the users including those that have permission to create a project. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Allow to modify navigation menu for user interface: after pressing button "+", only the option to create an issue will be available for all the users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a comment is added such as 'test 123' and then deleting the comment 'test 123', the system would state that the user who deleted the comment *has made changes to it*. This should be changed to the comment *has been deleted*.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to any issue and make a comment
 # From there delete that particular comment
 # You would then have to go to the History tab and you would see the changes you have made to the comment

h3. Expected Results

The result would show you that you have deleted the comment
h3. Actual Result

It would show the user that "Tom made changes" to the comment
fields.summary: When comment is deleted, it states that the user have made changes to the comment

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, when accessing the Application Navigator, you can specify in the "Groups" which groups you want to restrict them from accessing those options in the Application Switcher menu. This can be cumbersome, as the users will keep having to update this portion when new groups and new users are created as the access is available by default to everyone.

 
h3. *Actual Results*

By default, the Application Switcher menu is made available to be viewed to everyone by default unless specified exclusively.
h3. *Expected Results*

 

Reverse the current functionality, by ensuring that it is locked from every user by default with the exception of "site-admin" unless specified in the "Groups" column to allow the user from that group to view the options in the Application Switcher menu. Much like how the permission scheme works, access allowed only if specified.
h3. *Why is This Required*

This can help to improve security to ensure users who are not specified in the group are not mistakenly allowed to be able to access the menu in the Application Switcher. This also helps to empower the user with more management and control in a much simpler process instead of keeping track of the Application Switcher each and every time some changes are made to the users or groups in the instance.
fields.summary: Application Navigator To Limit all Access To View By Default

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
 * The + button only leads to 2 options (invite user/create group) which is unnecessary. They should just be left under User Management of the Administration nav bar. Easier to find and less clicks to reach

 - [instance].atlassian.net/admin/users/add only allows one at a time, but can set Full Name and username

 - [instance].atlassian.net/admin/users/invite allows bulk users, but you can’t define the Full Name or username.

 - The Quick Add form allows adding up to 3 users and can define Full Name, but not username.

 - The Quick Add form is actually the most useful (you can set Full Name and do a couple user at a time. Username is not so important)

 
h3. Suggested Solution
 - You should have one single bulk add option that combines all of these. Allowing you to set Full Name, Username and is a bulk add

h3. Workaround

Add users one at a time whilst being able to set full name and username from [xyz.atlassian.net/admin/users/add|https://venetian.atlassian.net/admin/users/add]
fields.summary: Merge multiple User Management Invite forms and include full user details on all

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the new Jira user interface, when changing the sidebar color of the instance, the color of the text, dashboard lines and other pictures doesn't change.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the user to customise the color of the text.

Apply the color set for the sidebar also to pictures such as: dashboard lines and profile pictures.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Change of text, images and dashboards lines color in the new user interface according to the color set for the theme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there's no search criteria to search for dashboards which are shared publicly (with anonymous users) or with any logged in users.

At the moment the only criteria for searching dashboards are:
* Search (text field): to search for dashboards that the name and description contains the text
* Owner (user picker field): to search for dashboards with specific owner
* Shared with (options):
** Anyone: to search for all the dashboards (all dashboards which the user has access to)
** Group: to search for dashboards shared with a specific group
** Project: to search for dashboards shared with a specific project

h3. Suggested Solution
Add criteria to search for dashboards which are shared with anonymous users (public) and/or with any logged in users.
fields.summary: Implement additional search criteria for searching dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

In the new Jira user interface, after changing the sidebar color of the instance, the color of the administration menu doesn't change. 
h3. Suggested Solution

The color of the administration menu should be the same as it is set for the sidebar.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Change color of the administration menu after setting a different color for the theme

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Even after revoking the access from the projects, the list of project still appears under 'Recent' in App Switcher. Clicking on the list brings you to a "This project isn't available" page error which is correct but after the access being revoked, the user is not supposed to be able to view any of the project names from before.

 

Environment

This happens in both Old and New Jira Experience App Switcher.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Give access to the user to a specific project
 # Let the user browse the project, so that it appears on the "Recent" list
 # Remove the access from the user to a specific project
 # The user opens the App Switcher and can still view the project listed under "Recent

h3. Expected Results

Under 'Recent', only projects which the user can browse and access should appear.

 

!app_switcher.png|width=764,height=360!
h3. Actual Results

Under 'Recent', projects which the user does not have access anymore is listed. The list should be refreshed to ensure it follows the new permission level given to the user. This can be seen working with the New Jira Experience, Project Tab but does not work the same way in the App Switcher.
fields.summary: Project still shows under 'Recent' in App Switcher despite revoking permission to access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Transition's post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" is no longer working when creating a sub-task. The security level for sub-task is always inherited from the parent issue, regardless of the post-function configuration or default security level.
h3. Note
 * As per [Configuring issue-level security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html], sub-task will inherit the security level of the parent issue.
 * As instructed in the page below, using post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" can automatically set the security level for sub-tasks during sub-task creation:
 ** [How to Automatically Set Issue Security Level for Sub Task During Creation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-automatically-set-issue-security-level-for-sub-task-during-creation-824349620.html]
 * This post-function was offered by JMWE add-on previously, however currently it's natively available in JIRA as per [JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extensions (JMWE) removal from JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-miscellaneous-workflow-extensions-jmwe-removal-from-jira-cloud-815262011.html?_cachebust=5135794310]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add two users to JIRA. For example: User A, User B
 # Create a project
 # In the project's *People* add User A to project role *Administrators*, and add User B to project role *Developers*
 # Create a issue security scheme (i.e. Test Security Scheme) with following security levels:
 ** Level C (Default)
 ** Level D
 # Associate this issue security scheme with the project
 # Edit the project's workflow and add the following post-functions to *Create Issue* transition using the post-function *Set issue security level based on user's project role*:
 ** If user is a member of the *Developers* role, set issue security level to *Level D* (Test Security Scheme).
 ** If user is a member of the *Administrators* role, set issue security level to *Level C* (Test Security Scheme).
 # Use this workflow for all issues and sub-tasks in the project
 # Log in as *User A* (Administrators) and create an issue in the project. For example *Test Issue*
 # Log in as *User B* (Developers) and create a sub-task for the issue created in the previous step. For example *Test Sub-Task*

h3. Expected Results
 * The security level for *Test Issue* be set as *Level C* (as per post-function)
 * The security level for *Test Sub-Task* be set as *Level D* (as per post-function)

h3. Actual Results
 * The security level for both *Test Issue* and it's sub-tasks (i.e. *Test Sub-Task*) are set as *Level C* (which is parent's security level)
 * Seems the post-function updates the sub-task'a security level first, and then it will be updated automatically matching parent issue's security level. Following records will be added under *History* tab in sub-task's Activity:

User B created issue - <time stamp>
User B made changes - <time stamp>
|| Field || Original Value || New Value || 
| Security | Level C [ 10000 ] | Level D [ 10001 ] |
| Parent |  | <parent's issue key> [ 10033 ] |
fields.summary: Post-function "Set issue security level based on user's project role" is not working for sub-tasks

fields.description:
Now we're writing issues like " [API]  AS a user I want to..." to identify the module/component where it belongs to. Basically this is stupid - because components are part of the system. But to display components - Jira support it only in multi-line mode - which is not preferable.

 

Please consider an option (set on/off) to display issues like [COMPONENT] TITLE, VERSION, EPIC, KEY, PRIORITY, STORYPOINTS.

 

Life would be great again! quickly assign issues to certain components and see where they are located. Have a quick look at your backlog and see which components are touched.
fields.summary: Show Components on issues in list so it's easy to identify certain stories

fields.description:
When we can use components as we work with versions and epics - life will be beautiful. Because it will be very easy to start using components by then. Additionally I've read articles where Atlassian writes that EPICS are basically BIG stories / a group of issues. Now I see that EPICS are used as components a bit which is not ok. Basically you want to close an EPIC - but now it's a kind of module so it will never be closed. We should use components, but it's not easy enough to assign issues to a component and when assigned - components are not visible enough.

From my perspective it would be great to have the Components in vertical menu, assign stories to it by drag-and-drop (and auto assign when configured), see components in issues automatically and be able to quick-filter on them

When it comes to how to display components in an issue - I will create another story.
fields.summary: Showing Components on vertical menu (EPICS, VERSIONS)

fields.description: It would be really usefull to add a component filter in the parameters of the time tracking filter.
fields.summary: Add Component filter to "time tracking report"

fields.description:
Similar to the display of Issue key for sub-tasks on the Board> Issue Details View it would be nice to see the issue key for sub-tasks on the actual issue details. I usually reference the sub-tasks in comments or description of the parent issue and expect to quickly see the issue number below in sub-tasks area, however the issue key is unavailable currently and requires clicking the sub-task and opening it in a tab just to copy the the key. 

Not a deal breaker, however if the key was displayed in the sub-tasks list would save a tonne of time clicking around.


 !image-2018-01-09-16-53-04-650.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2018-01-09-16-50-30-215.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display issue key for Sub-Tasks on Issue Details View
